2014-10-31.abstract: Williams-Sonoma will pay $700,000 to settle federal claims that it failed to notify regulators of a serious choking hazard in a line of window shades; admits that it 'knowingly failed' to alert Consumer Product Safety Commission of danger.

2014-10-31.abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Admin orders airbag supplier Takata to turn over documents and answer under oath questions related to defective airbag inflaters; order demands company turn over records regarding production, testing and subsequent concerns raised internally by automakers over the airbags; comes nearly five years after agency dropped inquiry into same issue.

2014-10-31.lead_paragraph: With one station switching in mid-October, and 500 doing so by December, the all-Christmas format is one of radio’s most enduring and profitable gimmicks.
2014-10-31.abstract: Nearly 500 radio stations around country are expected to switch to all-holiday music format by December, in one of medium's most enduring and profitable gimmicks; number of stations embracing format has nearly doubled in past decade, and competition between broadcasters is leading stations to make switch earlier and earlier in year.

2014-10-31.abstract: United States government reports that gross domestic product rose at a rate of 3.5 percent in the third quarter; higher-than-expected advance, driven by gains across the board, was bolstered by burst of military spending and a more favorable trade balance; report, along with crop of other positive economic indicators, buoys markets; skeptics are quick to point out weak growth in consumer spending.
